title: ChainBuildException: No producers for required item class io.quarkus.kubernetes.spi.DekorateOutputBuildItem
body:
### Describe the bug

We have a Quarkus project skeleton with the kubernetes extension removed. It's completely functional and can be used fine for development with `quarkus dev`, but `mvn clean package` fails with:
```
[INFO] 
[INFO] --- maven-jar-plugin:2.4:jar (default-jar) @ integration ---
[INFO] Building jar: /home/kjozsa/workspace/pd/lotuss/camel-integration/target/integration-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
[INFO] 
[INFO] --- quarkus-maven-plugin:2.15.3.Final:build (default) @ integration ---
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] BUILD FAILURE
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Total time:  4.436 s
[INFO] Finished at: 2023-01-18T14:50:48+01:00
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal io.quarkus.platform:quarkus-maven-plugin:2.15.3.Final:build (default) on project integration: Failed to build quarkus application: io.quarkus.builder.ChainBuildException: No producers for required item class io.quarkus.kubernetes.spi.DekorateOutputBuildItem -> [Help 1]
```
If I add the kubernetes quarkus extension, build succeeds.


### Expected behavior

Maven build should success without using the kubernetes extension.

### Actual behavior

_No response_

### How to Reproduce?

_No response_

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "17.0.5" 2022-10-18 OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 17.0.5+1) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 17.0.5+1, mixed mode)
